column1: inlustris 161064512160 "2017-05-25 18:17:49 GMT" https://inlustris.tumblr.com/post/161064512160/onoheiwa-smolsarcasticraspberry "onoheiwa:  smolsarcasticraspberry:  halespecterwinchester:  greaseonmymouth:  just-shower-thoughts: My ability to proofread increases by 1000% after I hit â€œSubmitâ€. this is often because when youâ€™ve submitted something (like fanfiction to ao3) it will be in a different font
column2: size and framing than in your word processor. The text will look different in the new environment so your brain stops skipping what looks familiar (like a typo that has been there since the beginning).  So
column3: tip: revise your work in a different font and size. I guarantee youâ€™ll catch more typos and mistakes than otherwise.  For all my writers (ones I follow and the ones that thankfully follow me)  also it helps if you shift it into a font thatâ€™s a bit more complex and harder to read
column5: because it requires more processing power from the brain and you therefore focus more on what youâ€™re reading and spot more mistakes.  Also
column6: if you wait even as little as a day
column7: though two or three is preferable
column8: youâ€™ll see a lot more of the errors. You canâ€™t beÂ immediately familiar with it; if youâ€™re memory isnâ€™t fresh then youâ€™ll have to read more carefully. Iâ€™ve found that to be especially helpful for adjusting awkward phrasing and weird sentences or dialogue
column9: rather than just the usual typos.Â  " False text
